info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 5 at 3:56PM CDT until September 5 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Runnels.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen northwest of Ballinger. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winters, Wingate, Norton, Crews, Pumphrey, Lake Winters Lake, Drasco and Wilmeth. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 0383 crossing Quarry Creek, crossings along County Road 328, crossings along County Road 201, County Road 322 crossing Big Coyote Creek, County Road 314 crossing Bluff Creek, crossings along County Road 205, County Road 328 crossing Big Coyote Creek, crossings along County Road 195, County Road 223 crossing Valley Creek and crossings along County Road 227. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING
